Link Mash (May 15, 2014)

May 15, 2014
1 minute read

The weekly Link Mash is a curated selection of tools, stories, and other links that I found during my travels on the web. All of my links can be found on my Pinboard; you can also find the Link Mash archives here.

  • The 21 Most Important Guinea Pigs. We all need to be more well versed.
  • How to create advanced actions in Launch Center Pro for iPhone and iPad. I’m starting to incorporate iOS Reminders into my workflow (primarily for location-based reminders). Unfortunately, there’s no direct URL scheme to use…so it’s Fantastical 2 to the rescue.
  • pickhardt/betty. Betty is a friendly English-like interface for your command line (like a CLI SIRI or Google Now).
  • The 12 Worst Things in the Star Wars Expanded Universe. On a related note… I’m sad to say that I’ve read most of these.
  • The 10 Best Stories In the Star Wars Expanded Universe. I haven’t read a Star Wars book in over 10 years, but man: looking at this list, I feel the sudden urge to pick some of these classics up.
  • skwp/dotfiles. That’s it. I’m done managing my own dotfiles; I’d much rather stand on the shoulders of far more talented giants. Best part: it’s forcing me to learn Vim.

This Link Mash was generated by PinPress, a simple tool to generate text templates from Pinboard data.

Theme crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
